entry.title: CTV++ OP_TEMPLATEHASH and OP_INPUTAMOUNTS
entry.summary: The discussion focuses on the implications of introducing new points on the continuum between CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) and transaction hash (TXHASH) in the context of specifying spending conditions for cryptocurrency transactions. The argument against adding new intermediary points emphasizes that doing so would complicate the activation process for any conditions, given that CTV provides maximum specificity while TXHASH allows for maximum generality. This perspective suggests that the existing range between CTV and TXHASH sufficiently covers the spectrum of specificity and generality needed for regulating user-defined spending conditions without the need for additional intermediaries, which could potentially hinder the practical implementation of these mechanisms.
